title: Levitation boots
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Levitation_boots/zh-CN "Levitation boots/zh-CN")

| \[   [![Combat boots.png](/images/1/15/Combat_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Combat_boots.png) [![Jungle boots.png](/images/f/fc/Jungle_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Jungle_boots.png) [![Hiking boots.png](/images/b/bc/Hiking_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Hiking_boots.png) [![Mud boots.png](/images/d/de/Mud_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Mud_boots.png) [![Buckled boots.png](/images/5/59/Buckled_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Buckled_boots.png) [![Riding boots.png](/images/4/42/Riding_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Riding_boots.png) [![Snow boots.png](/images/f/fe/Snow_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Snow_boots.png)***levitation boots |                                                               |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Appearance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                               |
| Slot                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots")                                  |
| AC                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [1](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")                          |
| Special                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | - [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation")                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                               |
| Base price                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 30 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                              |
| Weight                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [15](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |
| Material                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")                            |

A pair of **levitation boots** is a set of [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") boots that are made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and have a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification"); the default one associated with them is "a pair of [snow boots](/wiki/Snow_boots "Snow boots")".[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.2 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [5.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated levitation boots have a 9⁄10 chance of being [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), used armor dealerships and antique weapons outlets can sell levitation boots.

The [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of [Perseus](/wiki/Perseus "Perseus") on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") has a chance of containing a +0 pair of levitation boots; the second '[titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan")' map has a 3⁄4 chance, while all other variants have a 1⁄4 chance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have an effective \~8.01% chance of generating with levitation boots.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-mk_mplayer_armor-8)

## Description

While worn, levitation boots grant 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and extrinsic [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"), [auto-identifying](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the boots if the wearer is not already levitating. Removing the boots will cause the wearer to float to the ground. A source of "levitation-at-will" allows a character to float to the floor on command, while floating over a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") will cause them to crash to the ground and pull them off their feet.

## Strategy

For characters that are not in need of [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots"), or else have other sources of very fast speed (e.g. [spell of haste self](/wiki/Spell_of_haste_self "Spell of haste self") or [potions of speed](/wiki/Potions_of_speed "Potions of speed")), non-cursed levitation boots are great for crossing large bodies of water like those found on the [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest") and Medusa's Island. A [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation") is considered more convenient to free up the boots slot and maneuver down [stairs](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") - one advantage levitation boots have over the ring is that they cannot be destroyed by [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage, e.g. from [electric eel](/wiki/Electric_eel "Electric eel") bites, although a [water nymph](/wiki/Water_nymph "Water nymph") or [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") can charm them off.

The frequency of cursed levitation boots makes wearing boots of unknown [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") that are either unidentified or known to be levitation boots a [bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea"): cursed levitation boots will prevent characters from reaching the floor to grab items or travel down stairs, and any [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile") items dropped while levitating may break. Knowing the locations of sinks in the dungeon is useful for removing cursed levitation boots, but be sure that the resulting damage is not lethal. Cursed levitation boots are also considered a major [trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble"), so successful [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") is a viable solution for removal as well.

### Identification

Levitation boots weigh the same as [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots") and [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") at 15 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") - this makes them somewhat difficult to identify by weight, especially if a character already has intrinsic [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") and cannot eliminate elven boots by wear-testing. Auto-identification from wearing them carries the risks described above, unless there is a means to confirm their beatitude beforehand. [Price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") combined with a means of determining their weight can help identify levitation boots, since they only share their base cost of 30[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") with [fumble boots](/wiki/Fumble_boots "Fumble boots") and are 5 aum lighter.

## History

Levitation boots first appear in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

In [NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, wearing levitation boots while standing on a sink can cause the game to crash - this is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.3 "NetHack 3.6.3").

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), levitation boots are replaced by [flying boots](/index.php?title=Flying_boots_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flying boots (dNetHack) (page does not exist)").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), the statue of Perseus is guaranteed to contain a pair of levitation boots.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), levitation boots can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation") with a pair of either [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots") or [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 527](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L527)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 995](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L995)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 58](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/medusa.des#L58)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 157](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/medusa.des#L157)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/medusa.des#L275)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 375](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/medusa.des#L375)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 134](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L134): *`special` is only set to true when generating player monsters on the Astral Plane*
8. [↑](#cite_ref-mk_mplayer_armor_8-0) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 294](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L294): *this line requires `if (special)` and selects boots from all available types listed in objects.c*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Levitation boots

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[         
levitation boots
Appearance random
Slot boots
AC 1
Special
  • levitation
Base price 30 zm
Weight 15
Material leather

A pair of levitation boots is a set of boots that appear in NetHack. They are magical boots that are made of leather, and have a randomized appearance when unidentified; the default one associated with them is "a pair of snow boots".[1]

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 dNetHack
    • 5.2 FIQHack
    • 5.3 SpliceHack
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated levitation boots have a 9⁄10 chance of being cursed.[2]

General stores, used armor dealerships and antique weapons outlets can sell levitation boots.

The statue of Perseus on Medusa's Island has a chance of containing a +0 pair of levitation boots; the second 'titan' map has a 3⁄4 chance, while all other variants have a 1⁄4 chance.[3][4][5][6]

Player monsters generated on the Astral Plane have an effective ~8.01% chance of generating with levitation boots.[7][8]

Description

While worn, levitation boots grant 1 base AC and extrinsic levitation, auto-identifying the boots if the wearer is not already levitating. Removing the boots will cause the wearer to float to the ground. A source of "levitation-at-will" allows a character to float to the floor on command, while floating over a sink will cause them to crash to the ground and pull them off their feet.

Strategy

For characters that are not in need of speed boots, or else have other sources of very fast speed (e.g. spell of haste self or potions of speed), non-cursed levitation boots are great for crossing large bodies of water like those found on the Healer quest and Medusa's Island. A ring of levitation is considered more convenient to free up the boots slot and maneuver down stairs - one advantage levitation boots have over the ring is that they cannot be destroyed by shock damage, e.g. from electric eel bites, although a water nymph or foocubus can charm them off.

The frequency of cursed levitation boots makes wearing boots of unknown beatitude that are either unidentified or known to be levitation boots a bad idea: cursed levitation boots will prevent characters from reaching the floor to grab items or travel down stairs, and any fragile items dropped while levitating may break. Knowing the locations of sinks in the dungeon is useful for removing cursed levitation boots, but be sure that the resulting damage is not lethal. Cursed levitation boots are also considered a major trouble, so successful prayer is a viable solution for removal as well.

Identification

Levitation boots weigh the same as elven boots and water walking boots at 15 aum - this makes them somewhat difficult to identify by weight, especially if a character already has intrinsic stealth and cannot eliminate elven boots by wear-testing. Auto-identification from wearing them carries the risks described above, unless there is a means to confirm their beatitude beforehand. Price identification combined with a means of determining their weight can help identify levitation boots, since they only share their base cost of 30zm with fumble boots and are 5 aum lighter.

History

Levitation boots first appear in NetHack 3.0.0.

In NetHack 3.6.2 and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, wearing levitation boots while standing on a sink can cause the game to crash - this is fixed in NetHack 3.6.3.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, levitation boots are replaced by flying boots.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, the statue of Perseus is guaranteed to contain a pair of levitation boots.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, levitation boots can be created at a furnace by combining a ring of levitation with a pair of either high boots or low boots.

References

  1. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 527
  2. ↑ src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 995
  3. ↑ dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 58
  4. ↑ dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 157
  5. ↑ dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275
  6. ↑ dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 375
  7. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 134: special is only set to true when generating player monsters on the Astral Plane
  8. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 294: this line requires if (special) and selects boots from all available types listed in objects.c

Removing the boots will cause the wearer to float to the ground. A source of "levitation-at-will" allows a character to float to the floor on command, while floating over a [[sink]] will cause them to crash to the ground and pull them off their feet. ==Strategy== For characters that are not in need of [[speed boots]], or else have other sources of very fast speed (e.g. [[spell of haste self]] or [[potions of speed]]), non-cursed levitation boots are great for crossing large bodies of water like those found on the [[Healer quest]] and Medusa's Island. The frequency of cursed levitation boots makes wearing boots of unknown [[beatitude]] that are either unidentified or known to be levitation boots a [[bad idea]]: cursed levitation boots will prevent characters from reaching the floor to grab items or travel down stairs, and any [[fragile]] items dropped while levitating may break. Knowing the locations of sinks in the dungeon is useful for removing cursed levitation boots, but be sure that the resulting damage is not lethal. Cursed levitation boots are also considered a major [[trouble]], so successful [[prayer]] is a viable solution for removal as well. ===Identification=== Levitation boots weigh the same as [[elven boots]] and [[water walking boots]] at 15 [[aum]] - this makes them somewhat difficult to identify by weight, especially if a character already has intrinsic [[stealth]] and cannot eliminate elven boots by wear-testing. [[Price identification]] combined with a means of determining their weight can help identify levitation boots, since they only share their base cost of 30[[zm]] with [[fumble boots]] and are 5 aum lighter. ==History== Levitation boots first appear in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. In [[NetHack 3.6.2]] and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, wearing levitation boots while standing on a sink can cause the game to crash - this is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.3]]. ==Variants== ===dNetHack=== In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], levitation boots are replaced by [[Flying boots (dNetHack)|flying boots]]. ===FIQHack=== In [[FIQHack]], the statue of Perseus is guaranteed to contain a pair of levitation boots. ===SpliceHack=== In [[SpliceHack]], levitation boots can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a [[ring of levitation]] with a pair of either [[high boots]] or [[low boots]]. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Boots]]
